courses.name: Piano Literature I
courses.description: Survey of keyboard music from ca. 1600 to ca. 1800.

courses.name: Piano Literature I - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Survey of keyboard music from ca. 1600 to ca. 1800.

courses.name: Piano Literature II
courses.description: Survey of keyboard music from Beethoven's time to the present.

courses.name: Vocal Literature I
courses.description: Introduction to and study of song literature with emphasis on style and interpretation.

courses.name: Orchestral Excerpts
courses.description: Study and preparation of selected excerpts from the standard audition repertoire, culminating in a mock audition. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Classical Guitar Repertory I
courses.description: Survey of guitar repertory and history from 1400 to present.

courses.name: Classical Guitar Repertory II
courses.description: Continued study of guitar repertory from 1400 to present, with emphasis on organological development of the guitar and performance practice.

courses.name: Advanced Vocal Literature I
courses.description: Study of specific aspects of vocal repertory. Individual projects in research, analysis and performance.

courses.name: Orchestral Excerpts
courses.description: Study and preparation of selected excerpts from the standard audition repertoire, culminating in a mock audition.  May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Graduate Classical Guitar Repertory I
courses.description: Survey of guitar repertory and history from 1400 to present.

courses.name: Graduate Classical Guitar Repertory II
courses.description: Continued study of guitar repertory from 1400 to present, with emphasis on organological development of the guitar and performance practice.

courses.name: Piano Repertory I
courses.description: Study of specific aspects of Baroque and Classical keyboard music. Individual projects in research, analysis and performance.

courses.name: Piano Repertory II
courses.description: Study of specific aspects of nineteenth- and twentieth century piano music. Individual projects in research, analysis and performance.

courses.name: Choral Repertory
courses.description: Survey of choral works from selected periods with an emphasis on various aspects of choral performance. May be repeated once for additional credit.

courses.name: Band Repertory
courses.description: To survey band and wind ensemble repertoire with emphasis on various aspects of performance practice in order to prepare the student for a career which includes conducting advanced high school and college bands and wind ensembles.

courses.name: Orchestral Repertory
courses.description: A survey of orchestral repertory, emphasizing various aspects of performance practice. Appropriate for graduate music conducting majors who wish to pursue a career which includes conducting orchestras at the advanced high school, college, and professional levels. May be repeated.
courses.prerequisites: Conducting experience at the high school or college level and instructor's consent
